bioghist.p: The New Century Club, the first women's club in Philadelphia, established The New Century Guild in 1882 to aid "women without material assistance of male support." They provided evening classes for working women in dressmaking, millinery, cooking, and secretarial training. By the 1920s, it was also serving as a center for business and professional women to gather and included a library. Starting at Girard St., the Guild moved to 1227 Arch St. in 1893, and finally settled at 1307 Locust St. in 1906.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes extensive information on the Guild's day-to-day operations through minutes of the Executive Board and regular meetings, treasurer's accounts, membership roles and newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
